items.title: Movie list week 7: Jodie Foster speaks French in elegant "A private life"
items.summary: Jodie Foster as a French-speaking psychoanalyst in Paris, Noomi Rapace as a stern Mother Teresa and a struggling Hollywood extra are three colorful characters this week. DN's film editor Helena Lindblad lists the best films in theaters right now.
items.title_original: Filmlistan vecka 7: Jodie Foster pratar franska i eleganta ”Ett privat liv”
items.summary_original: Jodie Foster som fransktalande psykoanalytiker i Paris, Noomi Rapace som en sträng Moder Teresa och en kämpande Hollywood-statist är tre färgstarka rollfigurer i veckan. DN:s filmredaktör Helena Lindblad listar de bästa filmerna på bio just nu.

items.title: The lawyer's threat - send criminal clients on the ex-girlfriend
items.summary: During the summer and autumn of last year, a lawyer in Dalarna allegedly committed several serious crimes against his former girlfriend. According to the indictment, the man, who is in his 40s, secretly filmed, threatened with a knife and abused her. And when the lawyer understood that she was about to report him, he allegedly used his position to intimidate her into silence. According to the indictment, he threatened the girlfriend to send a former client on her. The woman testifies that he says his clients will do "anything" for him, gave her the name of a convicted felon and threatened to have a "quick talk" with her. Recorded the conversation The lawyer also threatened to counter-report the woman for rape if she went ahead with a police report, something she recorded with the phone: "You say you're going to report me for rape," she says in the recording. "Yes, I will have to," he replies. When asked why he needs it, he replies that he has to "protect himself". "Okay, so you protect yourself. There's no reason to report anyone, is it? Unless I've done it." "That's how it works." The woman tells in questioning that she feels afraid of him and gets heart palpitations when she hears his voice after the events. Denies crime The lawyer is now charged with gross breach of the peace, which includes the violent crimes, and assault in court proceedings. He denies any crime, and believes that the bruises she says occurred during an assault are due to her "stumbling into things". Last fall, the man received a warning and a fine of SEK 250,000 from the Bar Association after appearing under the influence in the district court, according to Falu-Kuriren. In addition, he was convicted of aggravated drunken driving twice in one year.
items.title_original: Advokatens hot – skicka kriminella klienter på exflickvännen
items.summary_original: Under sommaren och hösten förra året ska en advokat i Dalarna ha begått flera grova brott mot sin tidigare flickvän. Enligt åtalet har mannen, som är i 40-årsåldern, smygfilmat, knivhotat och misshandlat henne. Och när advokaten förstod att hon var på väg att anmäla honom ska han ha använt sin ställning för att skrämma henne till tystnad. Enligt åtalet hotade han flickvännen med att skicka en tidigare klient på henne. Kvinnan vittnar om att han säger att hans klienter gör ”vad som helst” för honom, gett henne namnet på en dömd brottsling och hotat med att han skulle ha ett ”kvartssamtal” med henne. Spelade in konversationen Advokaten hotade även med att motanmäla kvinnan för våldtäkt om hon gick vidare med en polisanmälan, något hon spelade in med telefonen: ”Du säger att du ska anmäla mig för våldtäkt”, säger hon i inspelningen. ”Ja, jag kommer att behöva göra det”, svarar han. På frågan om varför han behöver det svarar han att han måste ”skydda sig själv”. ”Okej, så att du ska skydda dig själv. Det är väl inte fog för att anmäla någon? Om det inte är så att jag har gjort det.” ”Det är så det funkar.” Kvinnan berättar i förhör att hon känner sig rädd för honom och får hjärtklappning av att höra hans röst efter händelserna. Nekar till brott Advokaten åtalas nu för grov fridskränkning, vilket inkluderar våldsbrotten, och övergrepp i rättssak. Han nekar till brott, och menar att blåmärkena hon säger uppstått vid en misshandel beror på att hon ”snubblar in i saker”. Under förra hösten fick mannen en varning och en straffavgift på 250 000 kronor av Advokatsamfundet efter att ha uppträtt påverkad i tingsrätten, enligt Falu-Kuriren. Dessutom dömdes han för grovt rattfylleri två gånger på ett år.

items.title: "Mette-Marit's scandal reflects Norway's decline"
items.summary: Good morning! Fat Tuesday is approaching. If you want to impress with your knowledge of rolls, SvD's test is a good place to start. Otherwise, this week's letter offers, among other things, insights into the Olympics and the turbulence in Norway.
items.summary_original: God morgon! Fettisdagen närmar sig. Vill du imponera med dina kunskaper om semlor är  SvD:s test  ett bra ställe att börja. I övrigt bjuder veckans brev bland annat på insikter om OS och turbulensen i Norge.

items.title: Increased support for social and medical reforms in Ukraine
items.summary: Sweden’s support to Ukraine makes a difference. The Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida) has approved increased funding for the National Board of Health and Welfare’s programme for expanded support to Ukraine for health and medical care, care of older people and children.
items.title_original: Increased support for social and medical reforms in Ukraine

items.title: The Riksbank exchanges EU payments
items.summary: Sweden's membership in the EU means monthly payments to the EU's budget. These are made in Swedish kronor by the Swedish government and are normally exchanged for euros on the foreign exchange market by a receiving central bank within the EU.
items.summary_original: Sveriges medlemskap i EU innebär månatliga betalningar till EU:s budget. Dessa görs i svenska kronor av den svenska staten och växlas normalt till euro på valutamarknaden av en mottagande centralbank inom EU.

items.title: Joint statement: Second High-Level Dialogue between Sweden and Colombia
items.summary: Joint statement by Swedish Minister for Foreign Affairs Maria Malmer Stenergard and Colombian Minister of Foreign Affairs Rosa Yolanda Villavicencio on 9 February 2026.

items.title: Göran Hjelm new deputy governor of the Riksbank
items.summary: The Riksbank General Council decided today to appoint Göran Hjelm as a new member of the Riksbank's Executive Board. Göran Hjelm succeeds Anna Breman, who left the Riksbank at the end of last year.
items.summary_original: Riksbanksfullmäktige beslutade idag att utse Göran Hjelm till ny direktionsledamot i Riksbanken. Göran Hjelm efterträder Anna Breman som lämnade Riksbanken i slutet på förra året.

items.title: Government presents new energy package for Ukraine
items.summary: Today, the Government presented a new SEK 1 billion support package for Ukraine’s energy sector, which has been subjected to intensive Russian strikes this winter. The support will help to meet the country’s urgent energy needs and bolster long-term energy supplies.
items.title_original: Government presents new energy package for Ukraine
items.summary_original: Today, the Government presented a new SEK 1 billion support package for Ukraine’s energy sector, which has been subjected to intensive Russian strikes this winter. The support will help to meet the country’s urgent energy needs and bolster long-term energy supplies.

items.title: Pål Jonson in Brussels for several high-level meetings
items.summary: On 11 and 12 February, Minister for Defence Pål Jonson will take part in the meeting of EU Defence Ministers and the Meeting of NATO Ministers of Defence. In conjunction with the NATO Defence Ministers meeting, a meeting will also take place within the framework of the Ukraine Defense Contact Group. Increased support to Ukraine will be a central theme of all three meetings.

items.title: Focus on violence against children as Minister for Social Services attends UN Session in New York
items.summary: The 64th Session of the Commission for Social Development opens today, 2 February. Minister for Social Services Camilla Waltersson Grönvall is representing Sweden in New York.
